meanings.definition: In a completely obvious and unashamed manner.
meanings.sent1: She blatantly ignored the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The student blatantly copied the answers from his friend's paper.
meanings.sent3: The cat blatantly knocked over the vase and then acted innocent.
meanings.sent4: The politician blatantly lied to the public about his involvement in the scandal.
meanings.sent5: The bright red car was so blatantly parked in the middle of the road that it caused a traffic jam.

meanings.definition: Done openly and without any attempt to hide.
meanings.sent1: It was a blatantly obvious attempt to cover up the mistake.
meanings.sent2: The company's blatantly false advertising misled many customers.
meanings.sent3: The dog's blatantly guilty expression gave away that he had eaten the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The house had a blatantly bright pink door that stood out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The student's blatantly incorrect answer stood out among the rest of the class.
